Hello world!
Disabled / Deafblind
Areas of Law
Organizations and Lawyers
Organizations and Lawyers
Chicago Bar Foundation and Motorola Mobility are working together to help connect people to free or low cost legal assistance in and around Chicago.
Click on the "FIND HELP" button above to see a list of legal assistance available to you by specialty.
MainInstr
Speech-Disabled or Deafblind? CLICK HERE:
If you speak Spanish, CLICK HERE:
Si usted habla español, haga CLIC AQUI:
Contact us: The Chicago Bar Foundation - 321 S Plymouth Ct, Ste 3B, Chicago, IL 60604, 312.554.1204
If you are deaf, hard-of hearing, speech-disabled or deaf-blind....

You may contact the organizations listed in here through Telecommunication Relay Service (TRS). 
 
This is a free operator assistance service that allows you to place calls from a TTY to a standard voice telephone . 
 
To place a TRS call from a standard voice phone to someone who uses a TTY, dial 711 to be automatically connected to a TRS operator.
If you have a legal problem and can’t pay for a lawyer, do one or all of the following:
Call CARPLS, the Cook County Legal Aid Hotline at 312-738-9200 (if you are in Cook County)
Visit www.IllinoisLegalAid.org for free legal information and helpful form

Contact one of the legal aid organizations identified here. Scroll through the list to find the area of law you need, then click on the name to see a list of organizations that may be able to help you in that area.
Many more people need free legal help than the legal aid organizations can provide. Please be patient as you try to reach the organizations to find out if they can help you.
If you are Spanish speaking...
Si usted es de habla española ...
You can call CARPLS at 312.738.9200 or go online to www.AyudaLegallL.org
Usted puede llamar al CARPLS 312.738.9200 o visite el sitio www.AyudaLegallL.org
The best way to find out if you qualify for or can receive free legal help in or around Chicago is to call CARPLS at 312-738-9200.
You can get legal advice and instructions from the CARPLS hotline. CARPLS also may try to refer you to another legal aid program for further assistance.

The hotline gets many more calls than CARPLS can answer. Please be patient, it may take up to 20 minutes to speak with an attorney. During heavy call times, you will also have the option to leave a message so that CARPLS can call you back.
www.IllinoisLegalAid.org provides free legal information, helpful forms and other resources. The website will help you learn about your legal problem and how court works.

If you are unable to find a lawyer to help you or need to handle your legal problem on your own, www.IllinoisLegalAid.org can help you create forms and give you instructions about representing yourself.
